trans-unit.source: How to use Notification Hubs with PHP
trans-unit.target: How to use Notification Hubs with PHP

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs from a PHP back-end.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs from a PHP back-end.

trans-unit.source: You can access all Notification Hubs features from a Java/PHP/Ruby back-end using the Notification Hub REST interface as described in the MSDN topic <linkText>Notification Hubs REST APIs</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can access all Notification Hubs features from a Java/PHP/Ruby back-end using the Notification Hub REST interface as described in the MSDN topic <linkText>Notification Hubs REST APIs</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this topic we show how to:
trans-unit.target: In this topic we show how to:

trans-unit.source: Build a REST client for Notification Hubs features in PHP;
trans-unit.target: Build a REST client for Notification Hubs features in PHP;

trans-unit.source: Follow the <linkText>Get started tutorial</linkText><title></title> for your mobile platform of choice, implementing the back-end portion in PHP.
trans-unit.target: Follow the <linkText>Get started tutorial</linkText><title></title> for your mobile platform of choice, implementing the back-end portion in PHP.

trans-unit.source: The main client interface can provide the same methods that are available in the <linkText>.NET Notification Hubs SDK</linkText><title></title>, this will allow you to directly translate all the tutorials and samples currently available on this site, and contributed by the community on the internet.
trans-unit.target: The main client interface can provide the same methods that are available in the <linkText>.NET Notification Hubs SDK</linkText><title></title>, this will allow you to directly translate all the tutorials and samples currently available on this site, and contributed by the community on the internet.

trans-unit.source: You can find all the code available in the [PHP REST wrapper sample].
trans-unit.target: You can find all the code available in the [PHP REST wrapper sample].

trans-unit.source: For example, to create a client:
trans-unit.target: For example, to create a client:

trans-unit.source: To send an iOS native notification:
trans-unit.target: To send an iOS native notification:

trans-unit.source: If you did not already, please follow our [Get started tutorial] up to the last section where you have to implement the back-end.
trans-unit.target: If you did not already, please follow our [Get started tutorial] up to the last section where you have to implement the back-end.

trans-unit.source: Also, if you want you can use the code from the [PHP REST wrapper sample] and go directly to the <linkText>Complete the tutorial</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: Also, if you want you can use the code from the [PHP REST wrapper sample] and go directly to the <linkText>Complete the tutorial</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: All the details to implement a full REST wrapper can be found on <linkText>MSDN</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: All the details to implement a full REST wrapper can be found on <linkText>MSDN</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this section we will describe the PHP implementation of the main steps required to access Notification Hubs REST endpoints:
trans-unit.target: In this section we will describe the PHP implementation of the main steps required to access Notification Hubs REST endpoints:

trans-unit.source: Parse the connection string
trans-unit.target: Parse the connection string

trans-unit.source: Generate the authorization token
trans-unit.target: Generate the authorization token

trans-unit.source: Perform the HTTP call
trans-unit.target: Perform the HTTP call

trans-unit.source: Here is the main class implementing the client, whose constructor that parses the connection string:
trans-unit.target: Here is the main class implementing the client, whose constructor that parses the connection string:

trans-unit.source: The details of the security token creation are available <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The details of the security token creation are available <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following method has to be added to the NotificationHub class to create the token based on the URI of the current request and the credentials extracted from the connection string.
trans-unit.target: The following method has to be added to the NotificationHub class to create the token based on the URI of the current request and the credentials extracted from the connection string.

trans-unit.source: First, let use define a class representing a notification.
trans-unit.target: First, let use define a class representing a notification.

trans-unit.source: This class is a container for a native notification body, or a set of properties on case of a template notification, and a set of headers which contains format (native platform or template) and platform-specific properties (like Apple expiration property and WNS headers).
trans-unit.target: This class is a container for a native notification body, or a set of properties on case of a template notification, and a set of headers which contains format (native platform or template) and platform-specific properties (like Apple expiration property and WNS headers).

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the <linkText>Notification Hubs REST APIs documentation</linkText><title></title> and the specific notification platforms' formats for all the options available.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the <linkText>Notification Hubs REST APIs documentation</linkText><title></title> and the specific notification platforms' formats for all the options available.

trans-unit.source: Armed with this class, we can now write the send notification methods inside of the NotificationHub class.
trans-unit.target: Armed with this class, we can now write the send notification methods inside of the NotificationHub class.

trans-unit.source: The above methods send an HTTP POST request to the /messages endpoint of your notification hub, with the correct body and headers to send the notification.
trans-unit.target: The above methods send an HTTP POST request to the /messages endpoint of your notification hub, with the correct body and headers to send the notification.

trans-unit.source: Now you can complete the Get Started tutorial by sending the notification from a PHP back-end.
trans-unit.target: Now you can complete the Get Started tutorial by sending the notification from a PHP back-end.

trans-unit.source: Initialize your Notification Hubs client (substitute the connection string and hub name as instructed in the [Get started tutorial]): $hub = new NotificationHub("connection string", "hubname");
trans-unit.target: Initialize your Notification Hubs client (substitute the connection string and hub name as instructed in the [Get started tutorial]): $hub = new NotificationHub("connection string", "hubname");

trans-unit.source: Then add the send code depending on your target mobile platform.
trans-unit.target: Then add the send code depending on your target mobile platform.

trans-unit.source: Running your PHP code should produce now a notification appearing on your target device.
trans-unit.target: Running your PHP code should produce now a notification appearing on your target device.

trans-unit.source: In this topic we showed how to create a simple Java REST client for Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: In this topic we showed how to create a simple Java REST client for Notification Hubs.
